author: Ernst
title: Pirate ? Ninjago ? Parts ? Multi useful !!
review:
Overall 5 bricks : This is a great little set from the 2016 Ninjago theme (subtheme Skybound). It is really a multi use set, for a Ninjago fan but also for Pirate fans or people who make MOC's. The price is really an engourament to get several of this set, outstanding !!

Building 3 bricks : No real big challenge here, the small plain is assembled in minutes and the mini figure in seconds. An inventively detail is the anchor used as tail of the small aircraft. The result is although a real cute small aircraft assembled with surprising parts.

Parts 5 bricks : Now here is really the outstanding quality of this little set. We get a great mini figure useful with both Ninjago and Pirates sets. Beside that all great parts including 2 bottles, 2 Ninjago swords and 2 Pirate pistols.

Playability 5 bricks : Simply because you can use this set with both Pirate and Ninjago adventures !!

Value 5 bricks : What is there to say here, a Collectable Mini Figure will cost you € 3,00 and this great 30 part set including a mini figure just € 4,00 ......

author: Hylocera
title: Cute Addition to Skybound
review:
Got this set out of a need to complete my Skybound collection, but this is actually a nice little build in its own right.

Box/Instructions

The plane comes in a polybag with a tiny instruction sheet folded over 8 or 10 times. The instructions are pretty straightforward and most of the plane can probably be built without them.

Parts

For a set this size there are a lot of nice parts. The wings are a pair of black katanas, the engines or exhaust pipes are trans-black bottles, and the tail is an anchor. Can never have enough of those parts.

Minifigures

The pilot of the plane is Bucko; he is the same as the Bucko in other sets so there's nothing too special here.

The build

The build is very quick, with one or two somewhat interesting techniques, but most of it is "typical" stuff.

The completed model

The finished plane is in a word, cute. It looks adorable next to Misfortune's Keep and some of the larger pirate vehicles. At the same time, it fits perfectly in a display as part of a swarm of the various gliders and small planes the pirates use. My only complaint is the use of katanas as wings, which look way too skinny.

While it's a nice set with nice pieces, I wouldn't necessarily get one as a parts pack. However, having 2 or 3 of these mixed in with the pirate army for a Skybound display is great, and for that this set is perfect.

author: Red_Five2
title: The skybound plane.
review:
Set 30421 (the skybound plane) comes with one minifig. The minifig has a green hat. The head shows a ginger beard, also it shows a black eyepatch. The torso has a white skull. At the back is one of the sword holders but this one is printed on the torso. The legs are orange and brown. The accessory is a brown pistol.

The plane build is very simple. At the back there is a black anchor. In the front there are two bottles. Also there is a place to sit. Right at the front there is also a brown steering wheel which they have on pirate ships. But there are two black swords.
